Author: garbowza
Title: Facebook's Beacon More Intrusive Than Previously Thought

Author: toffer
Title: Paul Buchheit: There's no such thing as a "social network"

Author: nailer
Content:
That seems to have struck a chord with someone.

I come to news.yc to read about hacking, business, and related topics.

I came to Digg to read about technology, and reddit to read about, well progressive things from a variety of areas.

The decline of reddit and digg was marked by many front page posts concerning reddit or digg themselves. I hope the decline of news.yc is not marked by many front page posts concerning news.yc itself.

I don't visit news.yc because I'm interested in news.yc - I'm interested, oddly enough, in Hacker news (with a business bent).

Then again, I fear that may have already happened - a post on news.yc on an article about 'hackers', that criticized the Morris worm was modded into oblivion for no other reason than Robert Morris later went on to found yc - though Robert himself has publicly expressed remorse for releasing said worm.

It seems news.yc is suffering from the cult of personality.

Author: jey
Content: When in doubt, use quantum bogosort. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bogosort#Quantum_Bogosort
